headline: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Boeing, Caterpillar, Chewy, Navistar & more
summary: Check out the companies making headlines in midday trading.

headline: IPhone 12 doesn't come with a plug for charging — here's what you need to buy
summary: The iPhone 12 comes with a USB-C cable in the box, but not the plug for your wall. You should buy a 20-watt charger from Apple or another company to charge at the fastest speeds.
"Straight blocking of URLs was wrong, and we updated our policy and enforcement to fix. Our goal is to attempt to add context, and now we have capabilities to do that," Dorsey said in a tweet.
headline: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey says blocking Post story was 'wrong'

summary: Amazon's Holiday Dash deals event features discounts across multiple categories.

Tech hasn't done this since 1993, chart shows. Here's what it means for the market's top-performing sector ahead of the election
summary: The Nasdaq 100-S&P 500 ratio just hit a new high not seen since 1993, and it could bode well for technology stocks heading into the presidential election, says chart analyst Todd Gordon.

headline: What Turner Sports, DraftKings and FanDuel could get out of their new sports betting partnership
summary: WarnerMedia's Turner Sports network wants to increase its ratings with its new partnership deal featuring sports betting companies DraftKings and FanDuel.

headline: Zoom, Peloton get Street-high price targets, but two traders are at odds on the stay-at-home stocks
summary: Stay-at-home plays Zoom and Peloton are surging after receiving Street-high price targets, but two traders remain split on the stocks' prospects.

headline: Nvidia’s $40 billion Arm acquisition could be targeted by Chinese regulators, analysts say
summary: China's Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) and China's State Administration for Market Regulation (SAMR) could get in the way Nvidia's Arm acquisition.

headline: Anwar Ibrahim Says Police Investigating Six Cases Involving Him

summary: As China recovers from the coronavirus pandemic, the country's central bank is more open to increasing loans to an already debt-heavy system than it is to cutting back.
headline: China is open to taking on more debt if that's what it takes to support the economy

summary: "The stay-at-home story, it's not quitting," CNBC's Jim Cramer said. "I bet they're going to keep roaring until we all have been vaccinated."
headline: Stay-at-home stocks like Zoom will 'keep roaring' until there is a coronavirus vaccine, says Cramer

summary: "I think it's kind of unfortunate that they're grouping the companies together, because there are so many different issues," the Microsoft co-founder said at

headline: Jim Cramer: Electric truck company Hyliion has a compelling story, but be patient on the stock
summary: "I kind of like the story, and I think it's worth buying if you can get the stock around $20, maybe less," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

headline: Google, in antitrust crosshairs, touts new 'helpful' search products
Jim Cramer tells traders to be ready for a 'buyable dip' from sharp stock pullbacks on European coronavirus fears
summary: "This morning's Europe-inspired sell-off turned out to be the perfect buying opportunity," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

headline: Twitter is having a major outage
summary: Twitter's website was down Thursday afternoon with users who tried to visit the service greeted by an error message.

headline: Stock futures flat after market suffers 3 straight days of losses

headline: Stocks keep sliding as stimulus deal uncertainty persists. What Cramer and two others are watching
‘No doubt’ that crucial U.S. fiscal stimulus is coming, IMF managing director says
summary: Kristalina Georgieva, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, told CNBC Thursday that she has "no doubt" the U.S. will implement a new economic stimulus package that will help reduce the current uncertainties for the global economy.
